text: A novel T-cell trans - activator that recognizes a phorbol ester-inducible element of the <extra_id_0> interleukin-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

The <extra_id_0> interleukin 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) gene promoter is recognized by several cell-type - specific and ubiquitous transcriptional regulators that integrate information transmitted by various signaling systems leading to <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production and T-cell activation .

text: Using a combination of transfection , protein - DNA binding , and in vitro transcription methods , we have discovered the novel T-cell - specific transcriptional activator <extra_id_0> TCF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( for <extra_id_0> T-Cell Factor-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , which recognizes a T-cell - specific response element ( TCE ) located within the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

Although the TCE is similar in sequence to a consensus NF kappa B site , several criteria indicate that <extra_id_0> TCF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is distinct from NF kappa B . However , like NF kappa B , <extra_id_0> TCF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity is induced by phorbol esters and other T-cell activators .
